conclusion: Analyze the path of light from the source through the parabolic reflector and into the hemispherical lens.
The light source F is at the focus of the parabolic reflector.
The parabolic reflector reflects light parallel to its axis, so light rays reaching the hemispherical lens will be parallel to axis MN.
The hemispherical lens has a refractive index n = 4/3.
When parallel light rays hit the hemispherical lens perpendicularly to MN, they enter the lens normally and continue straight through.
The transparent part is the arc length on the hemispherical surface where light can pass through, forming a circle with radius R.
The circumference of this circle is 2πR, but only the upper half is transparent due to the light-blocking plate.
The length of the transparent part of the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is πR.
The length of the transparent part of all the light entering perpendicular to MN on the lens spherical surface is πR.
